title: Where Should I Eat?
description: Built for the indecisive souls who spend hours trying to find the right place to eat. This is a minimal Flask application that generates random results based on specific preference and location inputs using the Yelp API
tech: Python, Flask Framework, Bulma CSS Framework, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Yelp API

title: StartupFair.LA
description: I worked with startups and other organizations on campus to put together a startup fair for LA-based startups to connect with UCLA students. I was responsible for the website and promotional material such as flyers, and t-shirts
tech: HTML/CSS, JavaScript, BootStrap CSS Framework, PhotoShop, Illustrator

title: Arkaive
description: I focused on the front-end, bridging the gap between design and engineering to build a responsive, user-friendly dashboard for school administrators and athletic departments. Also, I was responsible for creating mockups of new app features and promotional materials such as decks and flyers
tech: PHP, Symfony Framework, Twig Templating, HTML/CSS, jQuery, JavaScript, BootStrap CSS Framework, PhotoShop, Illustrator

title: Cal Fussman
description: I developed a brand new responsive website for New York Times bestselling author, keynote speaker, and consultant Cal Fussman. In doing so, I strived for professionalism and simplicity to promote Cal's brand. We're currently working on rebranding to a more blue, optimistic vibe
tech: PHP, HTML/CSS, Legacy CSS Framework, JavaScript

title: Sigma Eta Pi
description: Tasked with redesigning and deploying the organizationâ€™s new responsive website, my goal was to optimize user experience and increase traffic with a professional, appealing design for the new website. Furthermore, I created marketing materials such as t-shirts, flyers, and banners using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
tech: HTML/CSS, Bootstrap CSS Framework, JavaScript, Photoshop, Illustrator

title: Yume Koi & Gardens
description: Developed a new eCommerce website using Shopify and Craft CMS to sell koi and koi products with ease of use in mind for the client. Currently working on developing a separate website for "Koi For Sale" using Craft CMS for content management and blogging
tech: Shopify, PHP, Craft CMS, HTML/CSS, Materialize CSS Framework, JavaScript

title: BoxCamp
description: Developed a brand new responsive website for the student-run storage company, implementing a fully functional payment system using the Braintree API and PayPal. Configured and maintained MySQL database servers
tech: PHP, HTML/CSS, Bootstrap CSS Framework, jQuery, BrainTree Payments

title: MCMXC Clothing
description: Designed and created website for local clothing company and integrated it with online store

title: Supreme ATC Bot
description: Developed a script that scans the Supreme webstore (supremenewyork.com) for new items based on specific keywords and images and automatically check out when found. Automated process to purchase items quicker (~2 seconds)
inspo: I'm a huge fan of Supreme and really like their clothing. Unfortunately, whenever new items are released, they are sold out in a matter of seconds, so the number of pieces I am able to buy are limited. Thus, I decided to wrote a python script that would add the items to the cart for me and checkout, so I can buy multiple items.
